page.title: 01GENERAL
page.content: Our block consists mainly of rural farmlands. The village of Langtree is situated one kilometre from the middle of the western edge of the block. Langtree is a village of about 5400 acres and 70 dwellings on the B.3227, some 3.5 miles south_west of Torrington. The village is of linear form.The parish includes the hamlets of Stibb Cross, Week and Stowford. The population in 1981 was 527. Being a rural area most employment is connected with the land and the supporting industries eg. M.M.B. Creamery,Torrington. In the village is a small primary school, a post office stores,the Green Dragon Inn, the church and the Methodist Chapel. There is a small playing field.
